魚.definition: fish (CL:條|条[tiao2],尾[wei3]); used in the names of various aquatic animals that are not fish (including abalone 鮑魚|鲍鱼[bao4yu2], alligators and crocodiles 鱷魚|鳄鱼[e4yu2] and octopi 章魚|章鱼[zhang1yu2])

魚乾女.definition: see 乾物女|干物女[gan1 wu4 nu:3]

魚具.definition: variant of 漁具|渔具[yu2 ju4]

魚台.definition: Yutai County in Jining 濟寧|济宁[Ji3 ning2], Shandong

魚台縣.definition: Yutai County in Jining 濟寧|济宁[Ji3 ning2], Shandong

魚尾紋.definition: wrinkles of the skin; crow's feet

魚峰.definition: Yufeng district of Liuzhou city 柳州市[Liu3 zhou1 shi4], Guangxi

魚峰區.definition: Yufeng district of Liuzhou city 柳州市[Liu3 zhou1 shi4], Guangxi

魚死網破.definition: lit. either the fish dies or the net splits; a life and death struggle (idiom)

魚水.definition: fish and water (metaphor for an intimate relationship or inseparability)

魚水之歡.definition: the pleasure of close intimacy in a couple (idiom); sexual intercourse

魚水情.definition: close relationship as between fish and water

魚汛.definition: variant of 漁汛|渔汛[yu2 xun4]

魚汛期.definition: variant of 漁汛期|渔汛期[yu2 xun4 qi1]

魚池鄉.definition: Yuchi or Yuchih Township in Nantou County 南投縣|南投县[Nan2 tou2 Xian4], central Taiwan

魚沉雁杳.definition: lit. the fish swam away into the depths, the goose vanished in the distance (idiom); fig. to have had no news (of sb who went away); to have lost contact

魚片.definition: fish fillet; slice of fish meat

魚生火，肉生痰，青菜豆腐保平安.pinyin: yu2 sheng1 huo3 , rou4 sheng1 tan2 , qing1 cai4 dou4 fu5 bao3 ping2 an1
魚生火，肉生痰，青菜豆腐保平安.definition: fish brings heat, meat brings phlegm, vegetables and tofu keep you healthy

魚目混珠.definition: to pass off fish eyes for pearls; to pass off fake products as genuine (idiom)

魚米之鄉.definition: (lit.) land of fish and rice; (fig.) fertile region; land of milk and honey

魚網.definition: variant of 漁網|渔网[yu2 wang3]

魚肉.definition: flesh of fish; fish and meat; (fig.) victims of oppression; (fig.) to cruelly oppress (i.e. to treat like flesh to be carved up)

魚肚.definition: fish maw; a food dish made from the swim bladder of fish

魚肚白.definition: fish-belly white (used to describe the dingy light of the dawn sky)

魚腩.definition: soft, tender belly part of a fish (considered a delicacy); (fig.) (sports) weak team; pushover; minnow

魚與熊掌.definition: lit. the fish and the bear's paw, you can't have both at the same time (idiom, from Mencius); fig. you must choose one or the other; you can't always get everything you want; you can't have your cake and eat it

魚與熊掌不可兼得.pinyin: yu2 yu3 xiong2 zhang3 bu4 ke3 jian1 de2
魚與熊掌不可兼得.definition: lit. the fish and the bear's paw, you can't have both at the same time (idiom, from Mencius); fig. you must choose one or the other; you can't always get everything you want; you can't have your cake and eat it

魚船.definition: fishing boat; same as 漁船|渔船

魚艙.definition: the fish hold (of a fishing vessel)

魚薯.definition: fish and chips (abbr. for 炸魚薯條|炸鱼薯条[zha2 yu2 shu3 tiao2])

魚蟲.definition: water flea (small crustacean of genus Daphnia)

魚貫.definition: one after the other; in single file

魚貫而入.definition: to walk in in a line

魚貫而出.definition: to file out; to walk out in a line

魚鉤兒.definition: erhua variant of 魚鉤|鱼钩[yu2 gou1]

魚頭.definition: fish head; fig. upright and unwilling to compromise

魚香.definition: yuxiang, a seasoning of Chinese cuisine that typically contains garlic, scallions, ginger, sugar, salt, chili peppers etc (Although "yuxiang" literally means "fish fragrance", it contains no seafood.)

魚香肉絲.definition: pork strips stir-fried with yuxiang 魚香|鱼香[yu2 xiang1]

魚鬆.definition: fish floss; crisp and flaky shredded dried fish

魚鷹.definition: name used for many fishing birds; cormorant; osprey

魚麗.definition: "fish" battle formation in ancient times: chariots in front, infantry behind; The Fish Enter the Trap (title of Ode 170 in the Shijing)

魚麗陣.definition: (archaic) formation of infantrymen led by chariots

魚鼓.definition: percussion instrument in the form of a bamboo fish (traditionally used by Daoist priests)

魚龍混雜.definition: lit. fish and dragons mixed in together (idiom); fig. crooks mixed in with the honest folk
